ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Progressive mixed hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Documented progression of hearing loss over 3 years with significant air-bone gaps bilaterally; right ear deterioration is more pronounced.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss given reported progression.
To evaluate speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To assess middle ear status given the mixed nature of the loss.
To evaluate the integrity of the reflex arc and retrocochlear pathways.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with a progressive bilateral mixed hearing loss, worse in the right ear compared to 3 years ago. The right ear shows a moderately severe mixed loss sloping to severe, while the left ear shows a mild to profound mixed loss. Word recognition remains good bilaterally. Tympanometry indicates normal middle ear compliance on the right but hypercompliance on the left. Reflexes were not measurable on the right due to seal issues and showed an ipsilateral-only pattern on the left.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Moderately severe mixed loss (250-3000 Hz) sloping to severe (4000-8000 Hz). Left ear: Mild sloping to moderately severe mixed loss (250-3000 Hz) sloping to severe/profound (4000-8000 Hz). Significant air-bone gaps bilaterally.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: RE SRT 65 dB HL, WRS 88% at 95 dB HL; LE SRT 55 dB HL, WRS 80% at 90 dB HL. SRTs agree with PTA.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Normal (Type A). Left ear: Hypercompliant (Type Ad).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Right ear: CNT due to seal inability. Left ear: Ipsilateral present (normal), contralateral absent. Reflex decay CNT.

proposed_items: Annual testing to monitor stability of hearing sensitivity
counseling_actions: Reviewed hearing test results with the patient
Discussed progression of hearing loss in the right ear and the larger air-bone gap
Recommended otologic consultation regarding the increased mixed hearing loss

escalation.rationale_short: Referral recommended to investigate the cause of the progression and the mixed component.
